haha...

We're going to use emoji heads as rewards for contributing in the upcoming Code Gallery. (launching Q1)
> - Ex: Contribute (TBD, maybe 25?) code gallery submissions, earn a emoji head.
> - Ex: Contribute (TBD, 50?) to get a emoji head with Will's hair :will:
We're also running Hack-a-Thons next year... with submissions going into the code gallery. We may include head emoji's for the 1st place winners.
number of submissions may not be the best criteria, maybe the better criteria is number of upvotes(The number could also be higher then)

The reason being - number of submissions doesn’t encourage quality, it encourages quantity - which is great for the code gallery initially but hurts overall quality of submissions.

Upvotes a user has would represent quality across the board.

For example if they had multiple submissions another person could upvote multiple of their projects. OR if they had only 1 submission, multiple people can upvote the 1 submission. either way it’s rewarding quality :wink:

>- Ex: Contribute (TBD, 50?) to get a emoji head with Will's hair

LOLOLOLOLOLOLOL :will:

that's true <@U7SL518D6>... Just spitballing here, but maybe a mix of both:
> Min 15 submissions
- and -
> Average of 10 upvotes for each submission.  (would need a min of 150 upvotes total)
